alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 9:04PM EDT until July 10 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown affecting Chester County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Open adjacent land next to the creek floods. At 8.0 feet, Dowlin Forge Road begins to flood. At 9.0 feet, High water on the Brandywine sends backwater up Beaver Creek. Beaver Creek floods inundating parks and the Downingtown Little League fields. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EDT Sunday was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 01/25/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (9 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Stg Time Date East Branch Bran Downingtown 7.0 9.0 Sun 8 pm 3.7 MSG 9.5 12am 7/10 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 500 AM EDT.
